str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To break in pieces, crush, thoroughly weaken. From sun and thrupto; to crush together, i.e. to dispirit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Readily. Adverb from hetoimos; in readiness.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
And, even, also, namely.
To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
